intro: Echidnopsis insularis, commonly known as the island echidnopsis, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its unique, tubular flowers and fleshy, leaf-like structures. The plant is adapted to the arid conditions of its habitat, with specialized features for water conservation. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, and it produces a distinctive fruit that splits open to release its seeds. Echidnopsis insularis is of interest to botanists due to its evolutionary adaptations and endemic status.
